qas.question: What buddhism encourages everyone to become bodhisattvas?
What is the idea there the practitioner promises to work for the complete enlightenment of all beings by practicing the six paramitas?
What are the six perfections under Mahayana teachings?

answers.text: dāna, śīla, kṣanti, vīrya, dhyāna, and prajñā

context: <a0_0>Mahayana<a0_0/> Buddhism encourages everyone to become bodhisattvas and to take the <a1_0>bodhisattva vow<a1_0/>, where the practitioner promises to work for the complete enlightenment of all beings by practicing the six pāramitās. According to Mahayana teachings, these perfections are: <a2_0>dāna, śīla, kṣanti, vīrya, dhyāna, and prajñā<a2_0/>.
